intro: Semele menezesii var. carinata, commonly known as the carinate semele, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, ribbed or keeled leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in dense forest understories. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a pale green to white coloration. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts to protect its natural environment.
